intro: Scrophularia armena, commonly known as Armenian figwort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, erect stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from June to August. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Scrophularia armena is valued in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
